revised_title: On Small Longitudinal Material Waves Accompanying Light Waves: A Study of Pressure and Momentum in Light Beams
tldr: The author investigates the flow of momentum in light beams and the accompanying longitudinal material waves. They propose that the force equivalent to the rate of flow of momentum across a plane perpendicular to a beam of light acts upon the matter bounded by the plane. The potential energy in these waves is negligible in comparison to the kinetic energy, and the fraction of the energy of the beam located in these waves is proportional to the intensity of the beam.
